meanings.definition: A person who persuades someone to do something by sustained coaxing or flattery.
meanings.sent1: The cajolers convinced their friend to join them by using sweet words.
meanings.sent2: She was known as one of the best cajolers in the group, always getting her way.
meanings.sent3: The cajolers at the party made everyone laugh with their smooth talking.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like cajolers, gently guiding him towards the right decision.
meanings.sent5: The cajolers in the story were so charming that they could convince anyone of anything.

meanings.definition: The act of persuading someone to do something by sustained coaxing or flattery.
meanings.sent1: His cajolers were so effective that he always got what he wanted.
meanings.sent2: The cajolers of the marketing team were skilled at convincing customers to buy products.
meanings.sent3: The cajolers in the play had the audience laughing at their clever tactics.
meanings.sent4: The cajolers of nature whispered to the flowers, coaxing them to bloom.
meanings.sent5: Her cajolers were like a gentle breeze, slowly swaying him towards their side.
